metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2819 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based Buffer Overflow in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 9.0.0211.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2819` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.11
vim-athena - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.11
vim-common - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.11
vim-gtk - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.11
vim-gtk3 - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.11
vim-gui-common - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.11
vim-nox - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.11
vim-runtime - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.11
vim-tiny - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.11
xxd - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.11
No subscription required

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> faulty code was added in version 8.2.2672, with commit b2cb6c8b, so, versions earlier than that are not affected. there is a possibility that version 8.2.2301 (commit 752fc692) is also affected, but the PoC provided didn't reproduce in this version. Anyway, at least versions prior to 8.2.2301 are not affected.

criterions.comment: vim package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.11').
